nodes.bodyText:
Good point 👍
And a good recommendation to optimize the OPCache with anonymous functions.
Perhaps, it's better to use directly 'Fortune::cmp', as it's a static method.
mmm, but the other way you get the complete namespace. OK
I tried both syntaxes in my micro benchmarks, and the difference was negligible. So I chose the cleanest syntax, since '\\app\\models\\Fortune::cmp' was ugly, and 'Fortune::cmp' would fail.

Have you tried that fail ?
because that file have:
use app\models\Fortune;
So I think that will work.
If it fails it is a failure in php.

No it won't work, and yes, IIRC, I did confirm the failure myself (but I've since deleted my test file).
From PHP: Namespaces and dynamic language features in the official documentation about callables: "One must use the fully qualified name".
